entry.title: 28 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 847 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 844 days. 
 - 282 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1039 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 390 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 924 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 16,892 Stratfor emails on Norway.
  • Mass surveillance system TrapWire, which was detailed in WikiLeaks' GI Files, has been linked to NextBus, which collects the GPS coordinates of cell phone users.
  • A Thai man has been sentenced to over 3 years in prison for distributing copies of a Foreign Correspondent episode and WikiLeaks documents.
  • Journalist Ryan Gallagher posted his notes on the ongoing WikiLeaks grand jury, estimating a possible end time between July 2013 and January 2014.
  • NYT eXaminer tweeted that their FOIA request on WikiLeaks, Bradley Manning, and The New York Times is due to be ready this month.
  • The Nation published an in-depth piece on the Obama Administration's crackdown on whistleblowers, focusing on four NSA whistleblowers who have been prosecuted: Thomas Drake, William Binney, J. Kirk Wiebe, and Edward Loomis.

Julian Assange News:
  • One of Julian Assange's accusers has fired her lawyer, Claes Borgstrom, and replaced him with Elisabeth Massi Fritz, complaining that Mr Borgstrom spent too much time speaking with the media. It was also reported that the prosecutor Marianne Ny had left the case, but the Swedish Prosecution stated that this is not true, and that Ingrid Isgren has come onto the case as another investigator.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Afghan anti-war activist and feminist Malalai Joya came out in support of Bradley Manning for "inform[ing] the world about the brutalities and inhuman acts of US army in my country".

entry.title: 27 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 846 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 843 days. 
 - 281 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1038 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 389 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 923 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 12,356 Stratfor emails on Finland.
  • Green Left Weekly published an article on how WikiLeaks the West's Iran war drive was undermined. This article is the second in a three-part series on WikiLeaks revelations about Iran (read the first part here).
  • A Department of Justice spokesman for the Eastern District of Virginia has confirmed that the grand jury investigation into WikiLeaks is ongoing. Despite multiple confirmations of the investigation, there are nonetheless multiple commentators in the British press who continue to deny the investigation.

Julian Assange News:
  • Julian Assange has won the People's Choice Human Rights Award.
  • In an interview with artist group Chicks on Speed, they discussed their new album which will feature a collaborative track with Julian Assange.
  • SAWC updated their timeline which details the Australian Government's betrayal of Julian Assange.
  • Justice Stefan Lindskog, the head of the Swedish Supreme Court, will be speaking at the University of Adelaide on Julian Assange's case. WikiLeaks noted that the Swedish Embassy is paying for the visit, which is happening shortly after Swedish Foreign Minister Carl Bildt's visit to Australia.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Over 28,000 people have signed a petition demanding that the 2013 Nobel Peace Prize be awarded to Bradley Manning.

entry.title: 26 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 845 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 842 days. 
 - 280 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1037 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 388 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 922 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 14,135 Stratfor emails on Denmark.
  • Glenn Greenwald wrote an article on how those who dissent from political orthodoxies tend to face attacks based on their personality or character. The article focuses on Noam Chomsky, but also mentions Daniel Ellsberg, Julian Assange, and Bradley Manning:
    • "Nixon White House officials sought to steal the files from Daniel Ellsberg's psychoanalyst's office precisely because they knew they could best discredit his disclosures with irrelevant attacks on his psyche. Identically, the New York Times and partisan Obama supporters have led the way in depicting both Bradley Manning and Julian Assange as mentally unstable outcasts with serious personality deficiencies."

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Association for Education in Journalism and Mass Communication (AEJMC) president released a statement on leak prosecutions, condemning the "excessively punitive" prosecution of Bradley Manning.

entry.title: 25 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 844 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 841 days. 
 - 279 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1036 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 387 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 921 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 20,065 Stratfor emails on Sweden.
  • Voice of Russia interviewed Mary Jo Pullen Hughes, who was the subject of several Stratfor emails. Ms Hughes believes she is being persecuted for truth-telling.
  • WikiLeaks' Twitter account was included in TIME's 140 best Twitter feeds of 2013.


Julian Assange News:
  • Full video is now available of the panel held after the Berlin performance of "Assassinate Assange". Speaking on the panel are Angela Richter, Jacob Appelbaum, Jennifer Robinson, Joseph Farrell, and Judith Horchert.
  • A video clip is available from Guillaume Grallet's interview with Julian Assange, in which he discusses Twitter, Facebook, and WikiLeaks' presence in France. Mr Grallet also describes a bit about Mr Assange's situation in the Embassy.


Bradley Manning News:
  • Whistleblower Jesselyn Radack wrote on how The New York Times finally seems to be understanding the historical impact of Bradley Manning's case.

entry.title: 24 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 843 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 840 days. 
 - 278 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1035 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 386 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 920 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • A U.S. diplomatic cable on Burma and the Rohingya people states, "Burma's military machine is top-down, xenophobic ... and craves respect". There are 174 cables containing the term "Rohingya".
  • Daniel Ellsberg appeared on The Scott Horton Show to discuss Bradley Manning's statements, the mainstream media's poor coverage of WikiLeaks, and the implications of the "aiding the enemy" charge against PFC Manning.


Julian Assange News:
  • In an interview with L'Express, Julian Assange discusses the continued work of WikiLeaks, surveillance technologies, films about WikiLeaks, his senate run, and how President Obama and Vice President Joe Biden are the real "cyberterrorists".


Bradley Manning News:
  • The New York Times published an article on the extreme secrecy surrounding Bradley Manning's case.

entry.title: 23 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 842 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 839 days. 
 - 277 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1034 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 385 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 919 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • Russian oligarch Boris Berezovsky has reportedly taken his own life at age 67. Mr Berezovsky is mentioned in 33 diplomatic cables and 266 Stratfor emails.
  • The Bulgarian Prosecution has confirmed the existence of a probe into investigative journalists Atanas Tchobanov and Assen Yordanov of Bivol, WikiLeaks' Bulgarian media partner.


Julian Assange News:
  • The play "Assassinate Assange" was performed in Berlin this evening. Afterward, a discussion was held featuring Jacob Appelbaum, Jennifer Robinson, Joseph Farrell, Angela Richter, and Judith Horchert. Live tweets from the panel can be read on #AssangeHau, and a short video of Mr Appelbaum speaking is also available.
  • Supporters of Julian Assange protested at the Swedish Embassy in London, as Mr Assange reached 9 months in the Ecuadorian Embassy.
  • In a recent interview, Kim Dotcom talked about how he respected Julian Assange and that "the idea behind his efforts is powerful and necessary".
  • Reports have come out stating there is a "secret friendship" between Julian Assange and Benedict Cumberbatch, who will be playing him in the film "The Fifth Estate". WikiLeaks tweeted on this rumour, "Reports of a "secret friendship" between Assange and Cumberbatch...  do not alter our previous statements about the film". Mr Assange previously condemned the film as a "massive propaganda attack on WikiLeaks and the character of my staff".


Bradley Manning News:
  • Daniel Ellsberg and Birgitta Jonsdottir will be speaking at a Bradley Manning event at Theaterlab in NYC, April 5 at 7PM.

entry.title: 22 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 841 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 838 days. 
 - 276 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1033 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 384 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 918 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • Today's episode of Democracy Now! focused on the BBC-Guardian exposé which uses WikiLeaks' Iraq War Logs to link Iraq torture centers to U.S. Colonel James Steele and General Petraeus.
  • A new website called "Cable Weaving" allows people to create story lines of documents from Cablegate by presenting references in context, and allowing users to select related cables.
  • Free shipping is currently available at the Official WikiLeaks Store using coupon code EASTER2013. All proceeds go to WikiLeaks.

Julian Assange News:
  • Julian Assange will be speaking at the public event "Modern Warfare Exposed" in London, April 6. Other speakers are Ian Cobain, Chris Cole, Michael Lyons, Adnan Sarwar, and Ben Griffin.
  • Julian Assange is one of the nominees for the 11th Annual Human Rights People's Choice Award.  Bradley Manning was last year's honoree.
  • The massive Extraditing Assange FAQ has been given an updated layout with added intro pieces.


Bradley Manning News:
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network issued a news update which covers a new whistleblowers documentary, an op-ed from Kevin Gosztola, and an investigation based on the Iraq War Logs.

entry.title: 21 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 840 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 837 days. 
 - 275 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1032 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 383 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 917 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 29,690 Stratfor emails on Holland.
  • A new book entitled "Beyond WikiLeaks", discussing the broader implications of the organization, has been published. The book contains writings from Yochai Benkler, Gabriella Coleman, Jillian C. York, and many others. (Note: There is a post on Reddit where people may ask questions to one of the book's authors.)
  • The first trailer of Alex Gibney's documentary "We Steal Secrets: The Story of WikiLeaks" has been released. The film has received heavy criticism from WikiLeaks, including in a leaked email from WikiLeaks' Joseph Farrell to "We Steal Secrets" executive producer Jemima Khan.
  • In response to L. Gordon Crovitz' widely criticized op-ed in The New York Times, Bill Keller wrote of his strong dislike for Julian Assange, but concluded that he still believes Mr Assange deserves protection under the First Amendment.


Bradley Manning News:
  • Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztola did a series of interviews with whistleblowers, asking them about their thoughts on Bradley Manning's case. Interviewed are Pentagon Papers whistleblower Daniel Ellsberg, NSA whistleblower Thomas Drake, and Justice Department whistleblower Jesselyn Radack.
    • Mr Gosztola compiled information from these interviews into an article on the perception of Bradley Manning.

entry.title: 20 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 839 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 836 days. 
 - 274 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1031 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 382 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 916 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 39,716 Stratfor emails on Belgium.
  • WikiLeaks lawyer Michael Ratner appeared on The Real News to discuss how The New York Times and "liberal media" helped sell the Iraq War. He mentions the Iraq War Logs and NYT's poor reporting on WikiLeaks and Bradley Manning.

Julian Assange News:
  • With the release of "Cypherpunks" in French, Julian Assange has done multiple interviews for French media:
    • In a video interview with Le Point, Mr Assange discusses social media companies and how they have reacted to government pressure (English, French subtitles)
    • In a radio interview with Europe 1, Mr Assange discusses the threats that the internet poses, including mass surveillance
    • JDN did an in-depth interview with Mr Assange, which covers attacks against WikiLeaks, the dangers of the Cloud, the future of information society, and other topics
    • Radio France interviewed both Mr Assange and "Cypherpunks" co-author Jérémie Zimmerman
  • Alison Jackson, known for her spoof videos and photographs, created a video depicting Julian Assange being snuck a laptop and cellphone while he was held in Wandssworth Prison. Ms Jackson previously created a photo showing Mr Assange playing cards with Hillary Clinton.

Bradley Manning News:
  • UC Berkeley's Edward Wasserman wrote on how the mainstream media has thrown Bradley Manning to the wolves by using WikiLeaks material, but failing to cover PFC Manning's case.
  • This week's issue of Rolling Stone features an in-depth article on Bradley Manning. An excerpt can be read here.

entry.title: 19 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 838 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 835 days. 
 - 273 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1030 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 381 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 915 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 53,502 Stratfor emails on Greece.
  • John Goodale, who was chief counsel to The New York Times when it published the Pentagon Papers, was interviewed about current challenges to press freedom. He stated, "The biggest challenge to the press today is the threatened prosecution of WikiLeaks, and it’s absolutely frightening."
  • As part of their "Icons of the Iraq War" series,  Radio Free Europe wrote about Namir Noor-Eldeen, the Reuters photographer who is killed by an apache helicopter in the "Collateral Murder" video.
  • FinFisher technologies, which were detailed in WikiLeaks' Spy Files, are being used to spy on activists in Mexico.
  • M.I.A. has released a new mixtape which references WikiLeaks. She previously released a mixtape dedicated to WikiLeaks in 2010, entitled VICKI LEEKX.
  • Natalia Viana, a Brazilian journalist who collaborated with WikiLeaks on Cablegate, was interviewed about the significance of the WikiLeaks releases and her thoughts on Julian Assange.

Julian Assange News:
  • An exclusive interview with Julian Assange will air tomorrow on Europe1 at 6:35PM (Paris time).

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network published a news update which covers dangerous errors in the press about PFC Manning, including a recent Wall Street Journal article and an op-ed by Bill Keller.

entry.title: 18 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 837 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 834 days. 
 - 272 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1029 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 380 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 914 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 27,181 Stratfor emails on Portugal.
  • WikiLeaks cables show how the U.S. and others tried to spin the 2007 National Intelligence Estimate which found that Iran did not have a nuclear weapons program.
  • Today marks 10 years since the U.S. first invaded Iraq.
    • Back in 2011, Glenn Greenwald wrote on how a WikiLeaks cable likely helped end the Iraq War. The cable showed an incident in which U.S. troops executed at least 10 Iraqi civilians, then called in an airstrike to cover it up.
    • Marking the anniversary, Greg Mitchell published an excerpt from his book "The Age of WikiLeaks"on the Iraq War Logs.
    • WikiLeaks' Iraq War Logs, released in October 2010, were used to map all deaths which occurred during the war.
  • Gordon Crovitz at Wall Street Journal wrote an article entitled "Aiding the Enemy Isn't Journalism" in which he questioned why Julian Assange wasn't also facing similar changes as Bradley Manning. The article immediately came under heavy scrutiny:
    • Freedom of the Press Foundation went through correcting the numerous errors Crovitz wrote on WikiLeaks, Julian Assange, and Bradley Manning.
    • Jesselyn Radack of the Government Accountability Project corrected the legal errors in the article.
    • Techdirt wrote on how Crovitz took many quotes out of context in order to present WikiLeaks as espionage.
  • WikiLeaks lawyer Michael Ratner appeared on Law and Disorder Radio to discuss updates in Bradley Manning's case, Bill Keller's heavily criticized op-ed on WikiLeaks, and the Iraq War anniversary.
  • AP's Matthew Lee was interviewed by RT where he discusses government intimidation of journalists and the war on whistleblowers. Lee is known for pressing State Department officials during press conferences, and has done so on questions regarding Julian Assange and Bradley Manning.
  • Beat the Blockade is asking WikiLeaks supporters to donate $5 to WikiLeaks on April 5, the 3rd anniversary of the release of "Collateral Murder".

Julian Assange News:
  • The first special theatrical screening of "Underground: The Julian Assange Story" sold out in Melbourne. These screenings, featuring Q&A panels and exclusive content, will continue across Australia for the next month.

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network posted some of the best media coverage of Bradley Manning's statement and the leaked audio recording of it.

entry.title: 17 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 836 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 833 days. 
 - 271 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1028 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 379 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 913 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks cables show that U.S. diplomats profiled Cardinal Bergoglio, now Pope Francis, back in 2005.
  • In an article on CIA Director John Brennan, a Stratfor email is referenced which states that Brennan "is behind the witch hunts of investigative journalists learning information from inside the beltway sources".
  • William Leonard, who oversaw U.S. state secrecy under President George W. Bush, stated that the Obama Administration has since abused the system for handling classified information.

Julian Assange News:
  • Italian journalist Roberto Saviano posted a photo of him with Julian Assange at the Ecuadorian Embbasy commenting, "Nonostante tutto, non smetteremo di ridere." ("In spite of everything, we won't stop laughing.")

entry.title: 16 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 835 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 832 days. 
 - 270 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1027 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 378 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 912 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks cables have revealed the U.S. fury at former Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez' legacy of solidarity, particularly with Haiti.
  • An article at WikiLeaks Press uses diplomatic cables released by WikiLeaks to analyse political challenges to mobile phone coverage in the West Bank.
  • An article at SKUP stated that the parts of "The Fifth Estate" script about Iran, which were heavily criticized by Julian Assange, have now been changed to Gaddafi's Libya. Mr Assange also criticized the movie's portrayal of WikiLeaks and its staff, calling it a "massive propaganda attack".

Julian Assange News:
  • Video is available of the Peace, War and Conscience conference in Berlin, where Julian Assange spoke.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztola wrote on how shameful he thinks it is that there is a lack of journalists covering Bradley Manning's case.
  • PBS's Arun Rath wrote on foreign media's interest in Bradley Manning's hearings, comparing it to the lack of American mainstream media coverage.
  • This week's On The Media podcast discussed Bradley Manning, including the "aiding the enemy" charge and media coverage.

entry.title: 15 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 834 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 831 days. 
 - 269 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1026 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 377 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 911 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 120,950 Stratfor emails on France.
  • Swedish Foreign Minister Carl Bildt has been accused of leaking secret information to the U.S., based on information from diplomatic cables leaked by WikiLeaks.

Julian Assange News:
  • "Underground: The Julian Assange Story" is the prototype for a new form of film distribution which includes special event screenings with Q&A panels. Screenings begin in Melbourne this Sunday and will continue to Sydney, Canberra, Byron Bay, Murwillumbah, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth over the next month.
  • Two months after the Sam Adams Awards, the Oxford Union has finally uploaded video of the previous winners discussing the award. Former Ambassador Craig Murray, himself a winner of the Sam Adams Award, attributed this delay and previous issues with videos (including audio issues and censorship of Julian Assange's speech) to the fact that they must be approved in advance by a board of trustees which includes UK Foreign Secretary William Hague and Louise Mensch.
  • Julian Assange spoke today at the "War, Peace, and Conscience" conference in Berlin. Video is expected to be released, and @HomoCarnula also live-tweeted his speech.

Bradley Manning News:
  • An article at PBS Frontline discusses the importance of independent journalists, such as Kevin Gosztola and Alexa O'Brien, who have been relaying the Bradley Manning proceedings to the public.
  • The conservative Rutherford Institute has come out in defence of Bradley Manning.

entry.title: 14 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 833 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 830 days. 
 - 268 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1025 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 376 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 910 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 53,776 Stratfor emails related to Spain.
  • WikiLeaks cables show the influence of Pope Francis, then Cardinal Bergoglio, on Argentine politics and his connection with the opposition.
  • For Sunshine Week, Glenn Greenwald wrote on the secrecy of the Obama Administration, with mention to the prosecution of Bradley Manning and the threat it poses to press freedoms.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Lawyer Floyd Abrams and Professor Yochai Benkler wrote an op-ed on the threat that Bradley Manning's case poses to press freedoms, specifically regarding the charge of "aiding the enemy".
  • Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztola held an AMA (Ask Me Anything) on Reddit, which focused on Bradley Manning's case, as well as other issues related to WikiLeaks and press freedom.
  • Clark Stoeckley, artist and owner of the WikiLeaks Truck, appeared on RT to discuss the leaked recording of Bradley Manning reading his statement. Mr Stoeckley believes the audio may have been leaked from the Government, as the audio is clearer than what he has been hearing in the press room.
  • WikiLeaks lawyer Michael Ratner appeared on RT to discuss the immense secrecy surrounding Bradley Maning's case and why the leaked audio of his statement is so significant.

entry.title: 13 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 832 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 829  days. 
 - 267 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1024 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 375 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 909 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • In light of the election of Pope Francis, WikiLeaks linked to their releases which mention him: 8 U.S. diplomatic cables and 25 Stratfor emails.
  • WikiLeaks cables show how the U.S. and Vatican are still hostile toward Liberation Theology, a philosophy which gives "preferential treatment for the poor" and supports social justice movements for workers, peasants, and indigenous peoples.
  • A new report published by Citzen Lab shows that 25 countries are using Gamma's surveillance Trojan "FinSpy". FinSpy's spying capabilities, including recording Skype conversations and emails, are detailed in WikiLeaks' Spy Files.
  • An article in ARS Technica looked at the many WikiLeaks copycat websites that popped up over the past couple years, most of which ultimately failed. WikiLeaks' Bulgarian media partner Bivol is one of the few that has managed to be successful.

Julian Assange News:
  • Ecuador is continuing to seek diplomatic agreements against Julian Assange's extradition to a third country. Ecuador FM Ricardo Patino states that he is optimistic about Mr Assange's future, and Dr Fander Falconi, Ecuador's Secretary of State for Planning and Development, said Mr Assange continues to be in good health and spirits.
  • The play "Assassinate Assange" will be performed in Berlin on March 23, followed by a panel discussion with Jennifer Robinson, Jacob Appelbaum, and Joseph Farrell.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Video and photos of a rally for Bradley Manning in Kabul, Afghanistan have been uploaded. The protesters held banners with slogans such as, "Bradley Manning, you are a hero of suffering Afghans!" and "When Bradley is stripped, America is exposed".
  • A new petition has been started on We The People calling for Bradley Manning's trial to be broadcast on CSPAN.
  • Trevor Timm of the Freedom of the Press Foundation appeared on The Young Turks to discuss the leaked audio of Bradley Manning reading his statement, commenting on how PFC Manning's trial has been one of the most secret in the modern era.
  • The leaked audio of Bradley Manning's statement has been covered by major news outlets around the world, although The New York Times is strangely absent.

entry.title: 12 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 831 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 828  days. 
 - 266 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1023 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 374 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 908 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 396,337 Stratfor emails on the UK. 
  • The Hindu reported on a WikiLeaks round table which was held in New Delhi. WikiLeaks legal adviser Jennifer Robsinon took part in the discussion, commenting on the widespread ramifications WikiLeaks had and how the investigation into the organization brings up fundamental questions of press freedom.
  • In an exit interview, Alec Ross, senior advisor for innovation to Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, stated that WikiLeaks had revealed "rightdoing" and shown that U.S. Diplomats are "very, very good at their jobs".
    • I sent a tweet to Mr Ross about a cable which revealed U.S. soldiers executing Iraqi civilians and then covering it up with an airstrike, asking if this was "rightdoing". He initially responded with the false statement that this was not related to the State Department cables, but has yet to further comment.
  • In an interview with The Verge, Jacob Appelbaum discusses Cypherpunks, WikiLeaks, surveillance, and more. He states that WikiLeaks is a "powerful and effective force for good in the world", and also mentions the suffering and torture Bradley Manning has endured.

Julian Assange News:
  • Ecuadorian FM Ricardo Patiño stated that he expects Julian Assange's case to be resolved this year, commenting that, with the reelection of President Correa, the Ecuadorian Government's decision will be unwavering for the next four years.
  • Reason posted a review of Julian Assange's book "Cypherpunks", calling the text "inspiring" and commented on the impressive debating between the four authors.

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Freedom of the Press Foundation has leaked an audio recording of Bradley Manning's hour-long statement read during his February 28, 2013 hearing in which explains his motivation behind leaking over 700,000 documents to WikiLeaks.
    • The U.S. Military stated that they had contacted Judge Lind over the audio leak and that they are "currently reviewing the procedures set in place to safeguard the security and integrity of the legal proceedings".
    • Daniel Ellsberg wrote on the importance of the leaked audio. He also appeared on Democracy Now! to discuss it, as well as comment on Bill Keller's recent op-ed on PFC Manning.
    • Glenn Greenwald wrote on the recording, commenting on specific parts.
    • Rainey Reitman of the Freedom of the Press Foundation appeared on HuffPost Live to discuss the recording.

entry.title: 11 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 830 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 827  days. 
 - 265 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1022 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 373 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 907 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 109,140 Stratfor emails on Germany.
  • WikiLeaks cables show that the Government of Sri Lanka does not want the ICRC or UN involved in the identification of those killed in the Sri Lankan Civil War.

Julian Assange News:
  • Gary Kennedy, Secretary and Treasurer of Hunter Trade Unions, was interviewed on why he believes Julian Assange would make a good Senator. 
  • Professor Ferrada de Noli posted the Powerpoint slides from his presentation on "Human-Rights issues in the case of Sweden VS Assange & Trial by Media" given at Örebro University.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Former New York Times executive editor Bill Keller wrote an op-ed describing what may have happened had Bradley Manning leaked to the New York Times instead of WikiLeaks, something which PFC Manning said he attempted to do so in his plea statement. Mr Keller immediately drew criticism for comments he made.
    • The Nation's Greg Mitchell commented on how Mr Keller blamed PFC Manning for not getting his call through to NYT, as well as his false portrayal of PFC Manning's stated motives for leaking.
    • Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztola commented on how Mr Keller said that PFC Manning's motives in the chatlogs with Adrian Lamo were different from his plea statement, when actually they were nearly identical.
    • Nathan Fuller of the Bradley Manning Support Network wrote on Mr Keller's mischaracterization of PFC Manning. He also posted excerpts from an email conversation he had with Mr Keller.
    • Jesselyn Radack of the Government Accountability Project said Mr Keller paints WikIleaks as a military enemy using phrases such as "internet insurgents" and "antisecrecy guerillas".
  • Bradley Manning's defense has been given permission to publish a redacted version of his plea statement. The only redactions are names and can be found in a pastebin from @AnonyOps, taken from Alexa O'Brien's transcript of the statement.
  • Attorney John W. Whitehead wrote on how the war against Bradley Manning is a war against all who speak out against injustice.

entry.title: 10 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 829 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 826  days. 
 - 264 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1021 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 372 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 906 days.


Julian Assange News:
  • WACA posted a response from Christine Assange to FM Bob Carr and Ambassador Jeffrey Bleich's appearance on Q and A. She addresses falsehoods they stated about Julian Assange's situation.

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network is holding a T-shirt design contest in order to spread his message. The submission deadline is March 25 and the winning design will be sold on the Support Network's website.

entry.title: 9 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 828 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 825  days. 
 - 263 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1020 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 371 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 905 days.


WikiLeaks News:
  • The New York Times public editor Margaret Sullivan wrote on the dangers of suppressing leaks, noting the prosecutions of Bradley Manning and CIA whistleblower John Kiriakou.
  • Cabledrum updated their archive of articles on the GI Files, which contains over 1400 articles.
  • Human rights lawyer Jennifer Robinson, legal adviser to WikiLeaks and Julian Assange, was named joint winner of Australian National University's young alumnus of the year.
  • An academic paper entitled "Digital Prometheus: WikiLeaks, the State-Network Dichotomy and the Antinomies of Academic Reason" discusses the effect WikiLeaks has had on global powers.

Julian Assange News:
  • Julian Assange's book "Cypherpunks" will be released in German on March 14, 2013.
  • Julian Assange's father, John Shipton, was interviewed about his son's work and the failure of the Australian Government to help him. Mr Shipton is currently acting chairman of the WikiLeaks Party.

Bradley Manning News:
  • The editors of The Nation published an article comparing the situations of Bob Woodward and Bradley Manning, noting how the press should be far more concerned with PFC Manning's case and the implications it holds for journalists.
  • Al Jazeera's Listening Post discussed the Bradley Manning case, focusing on the lack of main stream media coverage.

entry.title: 8 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 827 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 824  days. 
 - 262 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1019 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 370 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 904 days.


Julian Assange News:
  • A leaked email from WikiLeaks staffer Joseph Farrell spread on Twitter, before being confirmed to be authentic and posted on Justice for Assange. The email is to Jemima Khan, detailing Mr Farrell's disappointment in her choice of being executive producer for Alex Gibney's film, "We Steal Secrets: The Story of WikiLeaks".

Bradley Manning News:
  • Ethel Rosenberg's orphaned son, Robert Meeropol, spoke out for Bradley Manning saying, "The more people scream bloody murder, the better that is for Bradley Manning. I'm not sure it will make a difference [for the ongoing trial], but that's all we can hope for, is that people come out".
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network is seeking film proposals in order to bring awareness to Bradley Manning's case.
  • Nathan Fuller of the Bradley Manning Support Network wrote on how Bradley Manning deserves thanks for his alleged leaking of documents, not jail time.
  • Michael McKee of the Bradley Manning Support Network wrote on how mainstream media outlets have finally begin to cover Bradley Manning's trial and the importance of supporters who have been fighting for him since the beginning.

entry.title: 7 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 826 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 823  days. 
 - 261 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1018 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 369 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 903 days.

WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 4,723 emails from Stratfor on Iceland.
  • Metahaven posted part two of their investigation into the WikiLeaks logo design. They interviewed the designer, Aśka, and published previously unseen concept sketches.

Julian Assange News:
  • The Verge published an article examining the culture and influence of cypherpunks, including that of Julian Assange, from decades ago to the modern day.
  • Australian film "Underground: The Julian Assange Story" will make its U.S. premiere at Filmfest DC, April 11.

Bradley Manning News:
  • Alexa O'Brien published transcript of a question and answer session between Bradley Manning and Judge Lind regarding PFC Manning's plea statement.
  • WikiLeaks lawyer Michael Ratner wrote on his experience hearing Bradley Manning read his plea statement, drawing comparisons to Daniel Ellsberg's admission to leaking the Pentagon Papers.

entry.title: 6 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 825 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 822  days. 
 - 260 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1017 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 368 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 902 days.

WikiLeaks News:
  • An investigation which was sparked by WikiLeaks' Iraq War Logs has revealed the Pentagon's link to Iraqi torture centers. 
  • WikiLeaks released 98 emails from Stratfor on French Polynesia.
  • WikiLeaks cables show that Sri Lankan Army Commander Major General Sarath Fonseka stated, "we can’t take them to court for firing on civilians’ in the course of battle".
  • Only 1 in 2000 suspects in a Grand Jury are not indicted. To learn more about the Grand Jury into WikiLeaks, visit usvwikileaks.org.
  • WikiLeaks tweeted that they have raised $169,510 through Bitcoin donations.

Bradley Manning News:
  • The Bradley Manning Support Network posted highlights from Bradley Manning's plea statement given last week.
  • Researcher Alexa O'Brien appeared on Acronym TV to discuss Bradley Manning's plea statement.

Jeremy Hammond News:
  • Jeremy Hammond was arrested one year ago March 5. He has been in prison since and has yet to have trial.

entry.title: 5 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 824 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 821  days. 
 - 259 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1016 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 367 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 901 days.

WikiLeaks News:
  • Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez has died after a battle with cancer. There are nearly 6,000 diplomatic cables and over 17,000 Stratfor emails which mention President Chavez. There are also documents which mention his replacement, Nicolas Maduro: 310 cables and 1,700 emails.
  • WikiLeaks released 93,799 emails on Egypt from Stratfor.
  • In an interview with Fairfax' Philip Dorling, Julian Assange stated that WikiLeaks has unreleased secrets about the U.S., but that they will not release them until after the court martial of alleged source Bradley Manning.
    • WikiLeaks commented on this article: "WikiLeaks does not confirm or deny sourcing even if alleged sources make admissions. This is because, if true, the admissions are forced. Today's article in the SMH elides qualifiers. Possible imputations about Mr. Manning were never stated."
    • Jesselyn Radack of the Government Accountability Project appeared on RT America to discuss this latest information.
  • The self-immolation of Plamen Goranov is being seen as a symbol of new protests in Bulgaria. Major protests have broken out in the country after revelations about corruption in the country, including those released by WikiLeaks and its Bulgarian media partner Bivol. 
  • Metahaven published an article on the design history of the WikiLeaks logo.


Bradley Manning News:
  • Journalist Glenn Greenwald appeared on Democracy Now! where he discussed how the prosecutorial overreach in Bradley Manning's case could turn all whistleblowing into treason.
  • Al Jazeera's Inside Story Americas discussed Bradley Manning's plea statement in which he admitted to passing information to WikiLeaks and gave his motives. AJE talked with former U.S. DoD spokesman J.D. Gordon, followed by a panel discussion with author Chase Madar, whistleblower Jesselyn Radack, and Afghan War veteran Joe Glenton.

entry.title: 4 March 2013
entry.content:
WikiLeaks has been financially blockaded without process for 823 days.
Julian Assange has been detained without charge for 820  days. 
 - 258 days at the Ecuadorian Embassy.
Bradley Manning has been in prison without trial for 1015 days.  
Jeremy Hammond has been in prison without trial for 366 days. 
A secret Grand Jury on WikiLeaks has been active for 900 days.

WikiLeaks News:
  • WikiLeaks released 3,934 emails on Montenegro from Stratfor. 
  • WikiLeaks cables show how the Vatican attempted to increase its influence in Latin America with the help of the U.S.
  • EPIC Privacy continues to press for records related to the U.S. investigation into WikiLeaks. They have filed new court papers (PDF) to the Department of Justice.
  • Assen Yordanov of WikiLeaks' Bulgarian partner Bivol has been nominated for the RSF Netizen of 2013.
  • EFF's Trevor Timm spoke at Freedom to Connect 2013 on the Freedom of the Press Foundation, the WikiLeaks banking blockade, the secrecy culture in the U.S., and the importance of leaks.
  • Somerset Bean has designed a new informative full-colour, tri-fold flyer on WikiLeaks and Julian Assange, available to be printed and handed out.
  • Priest and human rights activist Father Dave wrote a blog post on his decision to campaign for the WikiLeaks Party this coming election.

Julian Assange News:
  • ABC Insiders discussed Julian Assange's run for Australian Senate, saying he has a "reasonable" chance at winning a seat. 
  • The Official WikiLeaks Store has released a new "Liberad a Assange" T-Shirt ("Free Assange" in Spanish).

Bradley Manning News:
  • Bradley Manning has been nominated for the 2013 Nobel Peace Prize. This is the third year he has been nominated.
  • Bradley Manning's lawyer David Coombs is seeking permission to post online PFC Manning's statement admitting to leaking documents to WikiLeaks. Meanwhile, the Bradley Manning Support Network has posted their transcript of his statement made in court.
  • Journalist Chris Hedges wrote on his experiences hearing Bradley Manning testify, commenting on the importance of his leaks and the cowardice of the media and U.S. Government.
  • Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztola wrote on how independent journalists are leading the coverage and bringing transparency to Bradley Manning's court martial.
  • In relation to its ongoing battle for transparency in Bradley Manning's case, the Center for Constitutional Rights has filed a supplementary declaration from Firedoglake's Kevin Gosztoa, who has been attending all of PFC Manning's proceedings.
